# Contraband
## SL-16 Restricted Items List [bold]Controlled Substances[/bold] ([color=#6d9eeb]Chemists[/color]/[color=#9900ff]Science[/color]) Explosive and pyrotechnic compounds excluding welding fuel contained in welders or welding fuel storage vessels.
([color=#9900ff]Science[/color]) Toxins.
([color=#6d9eeb]Medical[/color]) Chloral hydrate, Impedrezene, Ipecac, and Pax.
([color=#6d9eeb]Medical[/color]) Desoxyephedrine and Ephedrine.
([color=#cccccc]None[/color]) Vestine and any Vestine-based chemicals (Nocturine, Mute Toxin, Hyperzine, Lexorin and Tazinide).
([color=#cccccc]None[/color]) Mindbreaker toxin.
([color=#cccccc]None[/color]) Norepinephirc acid.
([color=#cccccc]None[/color]) Romerol.
([color=#cccccc]None[/color]) Space mirage.
([color=#cccccc]None[/color]) Stimulants, excluding Desoxyephedrine and Ephedrine.
[bold]Restricted Gear[/bold] ([color=#38761d]ERT/Central Command[/color]) ERT and central command clothing.
([color=#0000ff]Command[/color]) Command clothing.
([color=#ff0000]Security[/color]) Less than lethal and non-lethal weapons, excluding disablers and beanbag shotguns.
([color=#ff0000]Security[/color]) Security clothing.
([color=#ff0000]Security[/color]/[color=#0000ff]Command[/color]) Disablers.
([color=#ff0000]Security[/color]/[color=#93c47d]Bartender[/color]) Beanbag shotguns.
([color=#ff0000]Security[/color]) Flash technology, excluding handheld flashes.
([color=#ff0000]Security[/color]/[color=#9900ff]Science[/color]/[color=#0000ff]Command[/color]) Handheld flashes.
([color=#ff0000]Security[/color]) Helmets and shields.
([color=#ff0000]Security[/color]/[color=#0000ff]Command[/color]/[color=#93c47d]Bartender[/color]) Protective vests and chest rigs.
([color=#ff0000]Security[/color]/[color=#0000ff]Command[/color]) Restraining gear.
([color=#ff0000]Security[/color]) Security HUDs.
([color=#0000ff]Command[/color]) Administrative HUDs.
([color=#f1c232]Engineering[/color]) Engineering goggles.
([color=#cccccc]None[/color]) Improvised less lethal and non-lethal weaponry.
([color=#cccccc]None[/color]) Unauthorized PDA software.
([color=#cccccc]None[/color]) Syndicate clothing.
([color=#cccccc]None[/color]) Syndicate equipment, excluding communication equipment.
([color=#ff0000]Security[/color]) Syndicate communication equipment.
[bold]Restricted Weapons[/bold] ([color=#ff0000]Security[/color]) Lethal firearms, excluding: syndicate firearms, captain's saber, antique laser guns, and deckards.
([color=#ff0000]Security[/color]/[color=#b45f06]Salvage[/color]) Proto kinetic accelerators, glaives, daggers, and crushers.
([color=#ff0000]Security[/color]/[color=#0000ff]Command[/color]) The captain's saber, antique laser guns, and deckards.
([color=#b45f06]Salvage[/color]) Seismic charges.
([color=#f1c232]Atmospherics[/color]) Fire axes.
([color=#cccccc]None[/color]) Syndicate weapons.
([color=#cccccc]None[/color]) Explosive devices, excluding seismic charges.
([color=#cccccc]None[/color]) Swords.
([color=#cccccc]None[/color]) Improvised weaponry, including baseball bats.
([color=#cccccc]None[/color]) Lethal implants.
([color=#cccccc]None[/color]) Other lethal weapons.
## SL-17 Restricted Items Permits. [bold]SL-17-A[/bold] A Restricted Items Permit grants a sophont an exemption to own a normally restricted item.
[bold]SL-17-B[/bold] A Restricted Items Permit must be approved. It can be approved by a head of a department the item is restricted to or the CO.
